description: From Latin dēvōtus, past participle of Latin dēvoveō (“dedicate by a vow, sacrifice oneself, promise solemnly”).

adjectives.description: devote (comparative more devote, superlative most devote)

verbs.description: devote (third-person singular simple present devotes, present participle devoting, simple past and past participle devoted)

entries.meaning: to give one's time, focus one's efforts, commit oneself, etc. entirely for, on, or to a certain matter
examples: They devoted their lives to following Jesus Christ.
I devoted this afternoon to repainting my study, and nothing will get in my way.
The city was devoted to the flames.
